refnamediv.refpurpose: Create and verify RFC-6698 TLSA DNS records

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: tlsa generates RFC-6698 TLSA DNS records. To generate these records for older nameserver implementations that do not yet support the TLSA record, specify --output generic to output the tlsa data in Generic Record (RFC-3597) format. Records are generated by connecting to the website using SSL and grabbing the (EE) certificate and the CA chain. Depending on the type and selector used, this information is used to generate TLSA records. Currently. tlsa has no AXFR support for en-mass TLSA record generation.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS

listitem.para: Use a specific transport protocol (default: tcp)
Only print the DNS TLSA record
Use specified certificate file, instead of retrieving the certificate from the server
Use specified directory containing CA bundles for CA validation (default:/etc/pki/tls/certs)
Output format of TLSA record. "TLSA" for rfc, "TYPE52" for generic (default: rfc)
Usage type: public CA (0), EE match validated by public CA (1), private CA (2), private EE (3) (default:3)
The selector type describes what the type covers - full certificate (0) or public key (1) (default:0)
Type of the TLSA data. Exact match on content (0), SHA256 (1) or SHA512 (2) (default:0)

refsect1.para: If neither create or verify is specified, create is used.

refsect1.title: REQUIREMENTS
refsect1.para: tlsa requires the following python libraries: unbound, m2crypto, argparse and ipaddr
